place.name: HATCLIFFE
place.gazetteerText: HATCLIFFE, a parish in Caistor district, Lincoln; 4½ miles WSW of Waltham r. station, and 7 SW of Great Grimsby. It includes Gonerby hamlet; and its post town is Waltliam, under Grimsby. Acres, 1, 370. Real property, £2, 313. Pop., 159. Houses, 35. The propertyis divided among a few. The manor belongs to F. Sowerby and J. Coates, Esqrs. The living is a rectory, united with the p. curacy of West Raveudale, in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £353.* Patron, Southwell Collegiate Church. The church is plain but ery good, and has a tower. There is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
